page.title: 18SOCIAL LIFE IN CROUGHTON 2
page.content: The Village Club runs Senior and Junior Football and Cricket teams, playing fixtures in the area, and there are also teams for the pub sports. There are no children's organisations, so parents have to take their children out of the village for Brownies, ballet, Youth Clubs and so on. The youngsters tend to gravitate to the Village Club. There is no club for pensioners, and the WI is the only women's organisation. It has around 30 members, and meets in its own hall, a former cricket pavilion donated by the Bowlby Family of Croughton House many years ago. Keep Fit classes are currently held in the WI Hall, and it will be used for church services during the restoration next year.
